abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/GR_R_39X_V6B runtime.

GR_R_39X_V6B is to be used with the heavy-ion collision data from 2010.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

title: Condition data for 2010 CMS heavy-ion collision data

usage.description: If you are using the CMS Virtual Machine image or the CMS container image environments, then the condition data files will be served automatically from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/ or from a file server at runtime, and therefore you do not need to download these files. If you need to have them locally, you can download them from here.

abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/GR_R_44_V15 runtime.

GR_R_44_V15 is to be used with the heavy-ion collision data and proton-proton reference data from 2011.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

title: Condition data for 2011 CMS heavy-ion collision data and proton-proton reference data

Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/GR_P_V43D runtime.

GR_P_V43D is to be used with the proton-lead collision data and proton-proton reference data from 2013.

title: Condition data for 2013 CMS proton-lead collision data at 5.02 TeV and proton-proton reference data at 2.76 TeV

abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/STARTHI53_LV1 runtime.

STARTHI53_LV1 is to be used with the lead-lead simulated data at 2.76 TeV from 2013.

abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/STARTHI53_V28 runtime.

STARTHI53_V28 is to be used with the proton-proton simulated data at 2.76 TeV from 2013, needed as reference data for heavy-ion data analysis.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

title: Condition data for 2013 CMS proton-proton simulated data at 2.76 TeV for heavy-ion analysis
